lang.questionString: Your classmates assume that some students skip school due to lack of interest in learning. Talk to them to explore reasons behind student absences and convince them to advocate for education for all.

option.optionText: Anitha's family is conservative. Maybe they don't believe in educating a girl child.
I heard that since Anjali's family wants her to get married soon, she is unable to attend school.
Coming from a poor family, Ajay's father wants him to look after his sick mother instead of going to school.
Rohan might not be keeping well from using the unhygienic toilets at our school.
Girls too have a right to education, don't they?
Anitha's parents are uneducated and do not know the importance of education.
In her community, early marriages are quite normal, I believe.
Marriage can wait as her education is more important. Correct?
Being poor and being a girl is double the problem!
Being poor should not restrict Bellissima's education
I believe times have changed and both boys and girls must have an equal chance to education.
Girls' education reduces inequality and provides opportunities to fulfil their potential.
As parents, they should be aware of what is best for their girl child.
But her poor parents should not be blamed...
With education, one can have the opportunity to make their own future.
The parents must be made aware of the importance of educating their daughter.
Anitha could become a doctor, lawyer, leader, or scientist as per her wishes.
Think about it this way, an educated girl is more likely to raise healthy families.
This in turn will benefit our nation and strengthen our economy.
I think families can be both traditional and educated at the same time.
Anitha is a bright student and she deserves to attend a school like ours, right?
The parents' restricted mindset makes it difficult for girls to be educated.
It would be very unfair if Bellissima is not given the chance.
This will make Anitha's parents proud of her.
Education empowers women with knowledge on nutrition, hygiene, and basic healthcare.
Educated women can make their family prioritize health and well-being.
Every girl deserves an education that empowers them to build their own future.
The elders in the family may be interfering with the parents' decisions.
Sometimes social situations are more complex than they seem.
Teachers can help such parents in understanding the benefits of educating girls.
Perhaps there are cultural/economic reasons why her parents are not prioritizing education.
Traditions can be changed for the better to include compulsory education for all.
A teacher's praise can encourage parents to value education for their daughter.
Teachers can address parents' concerns and offer support and guidance.
If a girl misses out on education, we as a generation will never progress!
Education opens door to a brighter future, not just for girls, but for their families as well.
Yes. Sometimes, deep-rooted family customs cannot be changed.
I mean, Anitha needs full support from her family to continue with her education.
Being at home, she could contribute to the family in other ways
It's a shame as Anjali is one of the brightest students in class.
The school authorities should intervene to help!
Forcing her parents can complicate matters
This has been done for many generations in her family
The family traditions must be followed
This is the time for her to play and learn
Bellissima is very good at her studies
Bellissima's early marriage should be discouraged
Education is to be given priority
However, she could take up studies later!
Maybe, she is missing out on a good career to be able to stand on her own feet!
The family believes that education can be had later if she desires
Girls and boys have different goals in life
Working outside the home, is not looked at as a good option
But the family must realise, education is not just about science and maths!
Every effort must be made to make her parents understand the importance of education
It is a personal matter, and the family may not agree
Village elders should be involved in convincing her parents
Educated members of the family need to be involved
Education is the right of every girl!
There surely is a time and place for everything!
Positive examples should be given to show the benefits of education
Family Pride may be an issue at times
It is a delicate matter and has to be handled carefully
A solution which is helpful to all can be worked out
Bellissima's parents can be made to understand the advantages
The importance of Education in Bellissima's life has to be top priority!
At times, girls in families tend to carry a lot of burden at a young age!
The parents have a lot of say in this matter
If the will to learn is strong, problems can be overcome!
Being poor brings more obstacles that have to be overcome!
Thinking has to change!
Bellissima should not be so meek
Sometimes, they have a to make a difficult choice
Children are looked at as income earners!
Children, boys or girls should be given total freedom to learn and play
It is not the fault of Bellissima to be born a girl!
She will need someone trustworthy to guide her
However, there will be lot of disadvantages if she rebels!
It is not easy for others to judge the family's situation
Social workers can help to find a solution
Girls like Bellissima suffer a lot more in these cases
Laws should be made more effective to ensure girls can get educated
Bellissima will learn to adjust to her situation
It can be easier said than done in these matters!
It may be fate that finally decides
Bellissima has to stay positive and help her family in need
This will teach her many a life lesson as she grows up!
No one has it all easy, there will be some challenges!
Some have the determination to stand up and get past hurdles
Others may learn the hard way!
Bellissima has to keep trying and not give up
Fate can be cruel at times!
However, she should not be deprived of her education!
She needs help to rise from a situation where there is little hope.

lang.questionString: Anup is not able to attend school and the school authorities want to dismiss him. Let us give them reasons and convince the authorities to give him another chance!

option.optionText: The village road is flooded due to heavy rains
Anup is down with fever after drinking contaminated water
Anup's parents are poor and cannot afford school fees
Anup has to help his father ploughing the field as it is harvest season
Village authorities must take flooding precautions
School has the responsibility to ensure safe surroundings
This is Anup's fault as he should be more careful
This is not Anup's fault so he cannot be blamed
Anup lives in a poor mountain community
Anup lives in a slum area in the city
Anup should help his family in the busy season!
Anup should attend his classes and then help his father
Authorities can make alternate arrangements
The school can declare a holiday
School does not have the money
School should work with local authorities
Have online classes for now!
Arrange classes for another day
It is better not take a chance during bad weather
Early weather warnings systems should be followed
Internet Connectivity is bad
Provide stable internet
Another extra day of class!
The portion covered be covered
Children will be happy
Self study should be encouraged
Teachers can provide worksheets in advance
The portion for the extra holiday day could be taught later
They could take a loan
That is not an option for the school
There will be interference in school administration
It could be a win-win situation
It will be money well spent!
Money should be spent for school resources only
Look for rich donors!
Persuade private companies to sponsor
Some greedy individuals will only benefit
Progress will be slow and will fall behind!
The community will benefit
Students will benefit
This is the first time that he has been affected
Anup has been in a similar situation before!
The village wells have been contaminated after the heavy rains and floods!
This happens quite regularly as school children fall ill
Anup is a good student and he does not like to miss classes!
It is important not to take health matters lightly
Health is something that Anup must take care of!
Anup 's parents must ensure proper hygiene
Missing classes can take a toll on his studies
A healthy body and a healthy mind go together!
Anup could avoid drinking water outside the house
Anup can build up his resistance by following a healthy diet and so aim to not miss a single day of school!
This has been an important lesson for Anup and he will benefit from it
It is a one off case and there is no need to make a big issue of it!
Discipline and awareness are very important
Sometimes, these things do happen in spite of all precautions!
Everyone has been affected with the difficult situation
Could there have been some awareness created about the contaminated water?
A healthy environment is needed for learning to prosper
Children like Anup miss classes and fall back on their studies
The local authorities are aware of the situation
Children and the elderly have to always bear the brunt in these situations!
It can still be practised as these messages will be relevant at all times!
That would have been very timely
Parents can ensure that healthy habits are followed to avoid getting sick
Teachers have an important role in advising the ill effects of irregular attendance
Anup will have to work harder to catch-up
Anup must take care of his health by following safety precautions
Anup's parents are subsistence farmers with very little income
Anup comes from a large family
His parents are daily wage labourers
Anup's parents want him to support by joining them as a labourer
The local school should provide free education to Anup
A school close to the community will help!
Monetary help could be provided
Getting basic needs is a struggle
Although even if it is free, Anup will need to be supported with other school items!
Convince Anup's parents of the benefits of education
Anup will be able to reach school without problems
It can promote better understanding of the way of life of mountain communities
Minimum wages could be given for Anup's parents
Food for Work and free Education for the child could be an option!
Anup has to help out the family by working small jobs
Schools can provide free meals to ensure Anup attends school
There is a lot of travelling and Anup is affected
The money earned is barely enough for food!
The schools should provide him some concessions in attendance
If Anup is dismissed he will never get back to school
Anup's parents need to be convinced of benefits of education for Anup
Some incentives could be provided to Anup and his family if he attends school regularly
School education is free, but they cannot afford the books
If a minimal fee is charged, the parents will feel the pinch and send him to school!
After school classes should be available to poor students like Anup
Charities should step in and support the family so that Anup can attend school
With loss of education his option for a better livelihood will suffer!
Education is the right of every child and Anup should not miss out!
The season comes twice a year and is very important
Maybe, he can take up some tasks that he can do after school
Harvest season is a busy time and all hands are needed in the family!
Anup is not able to refuse his father as he has to complete the harvesting in time
Anup must be excused as a special case
The school timing could be adjusted for Anup, may be other students too will benefit
Anup could involve his school teacher to make his father understand that school is equally important
Elders of the family could be involved to reach an understanding
The school teachers may not be interested to get involved in these situations
The teachers may complicate the issue as Arun's father has a bad temper!
The role of education for Anup has to be given the importance it deserves!
The family occupation is equally important as it brings much needed income.
Families that are needy do not have many options
This will set a bad example, child labour is never a good thing!
Anup may not be able to cope up doing both the tasks
He could attend the morning or evening batch for the time being!
School authorities should help in these situations!
Children from poor farming communities cannot avoid such work
It is important for Anup to be involved in the family activities
He may have to work both in school and on the farm for during harvest
School could be suspended during these times
Alternate arrangements could be made by the school
Sometimes in families, earning income becomes more important than education
Anup understands the sacrifices he need to make for his family
Anup will be a fine example in the community by showing maturity at a young age!
There will be a sense of goodwill and common good!
Some planning will make it happen and give Anup a sense of commitment
Helping the family in times of need is commendable

lang.questionString: Convince authorities and well-wishers how Quality Education can be achieved with support programs that can help in earning a livelihood!

option.optionText: Support programs are needed in primary school so that all can read, write and have basic numerical skills
Support programs in collaboration with schools, to identify children who need financial sponsorship for training on job specific skills
Focus on support for educational courses to create specific job skills that are in demand
The early years of schooling are very important in learning to read, write and count
The early years should mainly focus on learning to think, be creative and curious!
The sponsors should be in charge to identify and set the targets
School has to be in charge to identify and set the targets
Is the aim of education always to get a job?
Education gives the ability to learn and explore!
This is the foundation on which further learning happens!
The teachers should be trained to understand the needs of the children
Expose the children to many topics and let them discover!
There should be a standard syllabus
Learning should be through fun activities and the support programs must address it!
It should be a mix of Learn and Play!
Each child is different in the way they learn!
It is better to follow a common teaching method that benefits the majority
The goals should be achieved by repeated testing
New testing methods will help to uncover hidden talents!
Practical outdoor activities must be included
Field trips make learning engaging for the children!
The methods of teaching could be made suitable as per the child
Teachers do not have time to find the right method for each child
Test results should be able to show the student's progress
Test results should not be the only way to judge a student's progress
Curiosity should be encouraged at all levels!
Reading and writing exercises should be fun and engaging
This will make sure all topics are covered
It may not be necessary to cover the entire portion
New teaching methods must be explored
These skills will be important for the studies to follow and the support programs will help to develop them!
Homework should be avoided
Homework helps reinforce learning, but it should be kept to a minimum!
There should not be a rush to finish the portion
Relevant topics should be given priority!
Teaching should be of the highest standard
Sometimes for better quality education, a wide range is better than a smaller focus
Students will find it easy to connect with talented trainers
They can mentor and support the students without being partial
The students should reach out to their teachers for guidance
All students must have access to support programs
That would depend on the teachers' availability
It is easier for students to discuss personal problems as they would trust their teachers
There can be delays in planning
Sponsors must have easy access to all the records and be able to monitor progress
Teachers should be able to suggest the best solutions
The right teachers should be given the responsibility
Teachers can take specific decisions accordingly and act as a go-between between sponsors and students
Teachers can also take up matters with parents
Teachers will be burdened with additional responsibilities
Other staff can be involved
Teachers involved should be committed
Support must be impartial
The sponsors know how to get the best from the students
Students can show their talents without being shy!
Experience will not count in all situations
They have a lot of real life experiences and can ensure that the program is successful
A desire to help is most important
Students in need, appreciate the help!
Even if a few student's needs are genuinely addressed, that would make a big difference!
Mentoring will encourage the students to appreciate the skill learnt
The desire to help is strong among sponsors
Students will benefit a lot from the guidance of sponsors
Sometimes, it is important for the student to get financial help!
This could be the one chance for them to grab!
It also has to be in a way that needy students get a exposure to skills that are not expensive to learn!
Yes, it is a means of earning a livelihood
Curiosity and self learning should be encouraged
Skill education is an important part of this approach that can work but can be very difficult to implement
Students need financial and moral support while they get skill training
Sometimes, the skills lie unused and neglected as students are not aware of opportunities
It is good to be exposed to many vocational skills
Skill building support programs should be started at an early age
Donors can step in and give much needed assistance on a case to case basis
The school can be made responsible to make use of the resources allocated
Donors need to ready to look at of possibilities to bring out such talents
Schools authorities need to be engaged as they are more close to students and parents
After basic education, the student can go for in-depth studies
Experts from various areas can judge the potential students and groom them
It is easier to learn a skill when young
Opportunity to learn multiple skills should be made available
Donors can help support motivated teacher to show the way!
Science and Technology need this approach!
Dedicated teachers and support staff can make the difference
Donors can play an important role in bringing a scientific approach
This will lead to all round development of the students
Students will be able to make better career choices
Learning by rote should be discouraged
Teaching methods can be adjusted to the topic being taught
Results may be slow to show initially, but will have long lasting effects
The end results will justify the approach and create job specific skills
The potential in every student needs to be encouraged!
This will make the country proud as this sort of learning will unleash hidden talent
Hygiene and safe surroundings in schools are a cause of concern for parents
Education is the most important function in schools, not hygiene
Students like Bellissima delay going to toilet due to the unhygienic conditions
Schools must have toilets that are clean and the authorities must take responsibility
Hygiene issues can overshadow education!
If hygiene is an issue, then the school's reputation can suffer!
Toilets should be kept clean as infections can occur!
A basic issue as this could have a severe impact on the health of the child
The children could also be involved and be supervised to keep the toilets clean
Maybe some third party could be involved in keeping the toilets clean
Adequate resources should be made available
Every thing necessary for good hygiene should be implemented with toilet training practices
This ultimately affects the studies and can result in poor results
Long term health problems will be the result
This may give rise to more infection!
Hygiene could be taught at an early age
This may be mean more expenses for the school!
However, safety issues should be also looked at!
Basic Hygiene practices should be made compulsory in all schools
School should be all about education
There are not enough toilets for the children at school
It can be a matter of concern if basic principles of cleanliness are not followed
Students like Bellissima cannot use the toilet facilities without concern
Education and basic amenities go hand in hand to ensure success!
Children are also to blame as they do not follow toilet hygiene rules
There is an attitude that this hygiene is not very important in school
School and local authorities should be involved
Parents should not have to worry about toilet issues for their child at school!
The focus should be on quality education and the rest will follow!
Toilet hygiene rules must be included in their education
